net.sandius.rembulan.runtime

Interface ExecutionContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MetatableAccessor, MetatableProvider, StateContext, TableFactory

    public interface ExecutionContext
extends StateContext
    An interface to the execution context of a Lua call.

    This is the interface to the runtime environment in which Lua calls are executed, providing the mechanisms for including coroutine switching and the (optional) cooperative scheduler.

    Note: Lua functions are not guaranteed to receive the same ExecutionContext instance between an invoke and a subsequent resume. Functions should therefore not retain the reference to the ExecutionContext that outlives an invoke or resume.

    Note: The behaviour of the methods in this interface is undefined when invoked outside a Lua function invoke/resume.

    • Method Detail

      • getReturnBuffer

        ReturnBuffer getReturnBuffer()
        Returns the return buffer used in this execution context.

        This is the mechanism by which Lua functions may return values (see e.g. ReturnBuffer.setToContentsOf(Object[])), or indicate that the return value is the result of a tail call (by e.g. ReturnBuffer.setToCallWithContentsOf(Object, Object[])).

        The return values of Lua calls initiated from this execution context will also be stored in a return buffer accessible by this method (e.g. by ReturnBuffer.getAsArray() or ReturnBuffer.get(int)).

        Note: the return buffer instance may change between subsequent invokes and resumes of the same function. The reference to the ReturnBuffer instance should therefore not be retained by the executed function beyond the scope of a single invoke or resume.

        Returns:
        the return buffer used in this execution context

      • getCurrentCoroutine

        Coroutine getCurrentCoroutine()
        Returns the current coroutine.
        Returns:
        the current coroutine

      • isInMainCoroutine

        boolean isInMainCoroutine()
        Returns true if the current coroutine (as returned by getCurrentCoroutine()) is the main coroutine.
        Returns:
        true if the current coroutine is the main coroutine

      • getCoroutineStatus

        Coroutine.Status getCoroutineStatus(Coroutine coroutine)
        Returns the status of coroutine as seen from the perspective of this execution context.
        Parameters:
        coroutine - the target coroutine, must not be null
        Returns:
        the status of coroutine from the perspective of this execution context
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if coroutine is null

      • newCoroutine

        Coroutine newCoroutine(LuaFunction function)
        Returns a new coroutine with the body function.

        The coroutine will be initialised in the suspended state. To resume the coroutine, use resume(Coroutine, Object[]).

        Parameters:
        function - coroutine body, must not be null
        Returns:
        a new (suspended) coroutine with the body function
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if function is null

      • resume

        void resume(Coroutine coroutine,
            Object[] args)
     throws UnresolvedControlThrowable
        Resumes the given coroutine coroutine, passing the arguments args to it. This method throws an UnresolvedControlThrowable: non-local control changes are expected to be resolved by the caller of this method.

        The reference to the array args is not retained by the execution context; args may therefore be freely re-used by the caller.

        Parameters:
        coroutine - the coroutine to be resumed, must not be null
        args - arguments to be passed to coroutine, must not be null
        Throws:
        UnresolvedControlThrowable - the control throwable for this coroutine switch
        NullPointerException - if coroutine or args is null
        IllegalCoroutineStateException - when coroutine cannot be resumed

      • yield

        void yield(Object[] args)
    throws UnresolvedControlThrowable
        Yields control to the coroutine resuming the current coroutine, passing the arguments args to it. This method throws an UnresolvedControlThrowable: non-local control changes are expected to be resolved by the caller of this method.

        The reference to the array args is not retained by the execution context; args may therefore be freely re-used by the caller.

        Parameters:
        args - arguments to be passed to the resuming coroutine, must not be null
        Throws:
        UnresolvedControlThrowable - the control throwable for this coroutine switch
        NullPointerException - if args is null
        IllegalCoroutineStateException - when yielding from a non-yieldable coroutine

      • resumeAfter

        void resumeAfter(AsyncTask task)
          throws UnresolvedControlThrowable
        Resumes the current call after the asynchronous task task has been completed. This method throws an UnresolvedControlThrowable: non-local control changes are expected to be resolved by the caller of this method.

        In order to mark task as completed, the task must call AsyncTask.ContinueCallback.finished().

        Parameters:
        task - the task to be executed, must not be null
        Throws:
        UnresolvedControlThrowable - the control throwable for this control change
        NullPointerException - if task is null

      • registerTicks

        void registerTicks(int ticks)
        Informs the scheduler that the current task is about to consume or has consumed ticks virtual ticks.

        This method only registers ticks with the scheduler. In order to pause the execution if the scheduler indicates that it should be paused, use pauseIfRequested().

        The behaviour of this method is undefined if ticks is negative.

        Parameters:
        ticks - number of ticks to be registered with the scheduler, must not be negative

      • pauseIfRequested

        void pauseIfRequested()
               throws UnresolvedControlThrowable
        Pauses the execution if the according to the scheduler this call should be paused. This method throws an UnresolvedControlThrowable: non-local control changes are expected to be resolved by the caller of this method.

        To pause execution unconditionally, use pause().

        Throws:
        UnresolvedControlThrowable - the control throwable for this control change

      • pause

        void pause()
    throws UnresolvedControlThrowable
        (Unconditionally) pauses the execution. This method throws an UnresolvedControlThrowable: non-local control changes are expected to be resolved by the caller of this method.
        Throws:
        UnresolvedControlThrowable - the control throwable for this control change
